intro: Haplocoelum jubense, commonly known as the golden starflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its striking yellow petals and star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves, and it produces small, elongated fruits that contain seeds. Haplocoelum jubense is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique floral structure.
